Work

Design & Development

IBM

I currently work at IBM as a full stack DevOps software engineer. I build new features for and maintain the Digital Marketplace Storefront and Digital Marketplace Search UI.

IBM Digital Marketplace

The storefront for the IBM Digital Marketplace is a NodeJS application running on Bluemix (Platform as a Service). React components are rendered server-side for speed and SEO value.

Technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Node, Gulp, Mocha, Bluemix (PaaS), CouchDB (Cloudant)
Roles: Programming
Screenshot of IBM Digital Marketplace homepage
Screenshot of IBM Digital Marketplace product detail page

IBM Digital Marketplace Search UI

Launching soon, the new search UI is a React-powered single page application with server-side rendering on initial page load for speed.

Technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Node, Gulp, Mocha, Bluemix (PaaS), Elastic Search
Roles: Programming
Screenshot of IBM Digital Marketplace search home page
Screenshot of IBM Digital Marketplace search home page with filter sidebar showing

UNC-Chapel Hill

While working on my MSIS at UNC-Chapel Hill, I worked as a Research Assistant. Below are some of the projects I worked on during my time at UNC.

AnnotatorOne Prototypes

The AnnotatorOne project was a research project to explore different user interfaces for large scale web annotations. Several iterations were created, one of which is viewable on Heroku. With thousands of annotations on a web page, I worked on several JavaScript/DOM performance improvements. On the design side of things, I created icons and worked on several interaction design challenges.

Technologies: Python, CouchDB (Cloudant), HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, AnnotatorJS, Heroku (PaaS)
Roles: Programming, Design
Source: https://github.com/headquarters/sils-annotate
Screenshot of the AnnotatorOne Prototype (1 of 2)
Screenshot of the AnnotatorOne Prototype (2 of 2)

MyBCRisk.org Responsive Website

The website mybcrisk.org contains a questionnaire for users to assess their breast cancer risk. As a responsive website, it works on desktop, tablet, and mobile.

Technologies: Ruby, Sinatra, SQLite, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, OpenShift (PaaS)
Roles: Programming, Design
Source: https://github.com/headquarters/bcerp
Screenshot of the MyBCRisk.org desktop home page
Screenshot of the MyBCRisk.org mobile home page
Screenshot of the MyBCRisk.org desktop question page
Screenshot of the MyBCRisk.org mobile question page

NC Hospital Charges Visualization

As part of a graduate course in Visual Analytics, I worked with 2 classmates on a D3 visualization of hospital charge data in NC. The visualization shows a map of NC, plotting averages for hospital charges by Diagnosis Related Group (DRG), on each hospital. A color scale is used to designate the range of low to high averages. Clicking a hospital brings up its details and shows how it compares to others for the same DRG. The site itself is hosted on GitHub Pages.

Technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, D3, jQuery
Roles: Programming
Source: https://github.com/headquarters/visualanalytics690
Screenshot of NC Hospital Charges visualization (1 of 2)
Screenshot of NC Hospital Charges visualization (2 of 2)

Etix

I worked at Etix as the sole front-end engineer from mid-2012 to mid-2013. I did some designing, some usability testing, a whole lot of refactoring of user interface code, and worked a little bit on some Java code in a J2EE web app that ran on Tomcat.

Style Guide

As my first order of business at Etix, I created a styleguide to give myself and the other developers some standards for developing user interface components. Since my departure, it's been heavily revised, so the current site most likely does not reflect what I created.

Technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP
Roles: Design, Programming
Screenshot of Etix styleguide (1 of 2)
Screenshot of Etix styleguide (2 of 2)

Checkout Process Redesign

I redesigned and developed a responsive template for the checkout process that led to a 2% increase in mobile revenue in its first month.

Technologies: HTML, Skeleton (Responsive Framework), CSS, JavaScript, Java, JSP
Roles: Programming, Design
Screenshot of Etix.com checkout process (1 of 2)
Screenshot of Etix.com checkout process (2 of 2)

Wireframes

I created conceptual wireframes for a dashboard and for the Etix print-at-home ticket. I worked with several stakeholders across the organization to gather requirements for the concepts.

Technologies: Balsamiq
Roles: Design
Screenshot of Balsamiq wireframe for a dashboard
Screenshot of Balsamiq wireframe for a print-at-home ticket

Schema.org Metadata Implementation

I implemented Schema.org metadata recommendations on the Etix site in order to provide structured data in search results in supported search engines. The accompanying screenshot shows an example of this structured data being used by Google to improve the search results interface.

Technologies: JSP, HTML
Roles: Programming
Example of Google search results showing Etix metadata

Lowe's Home Improvement

I worked at Lowe's Home Improvement as a front-end developer from 2010 to 2012. I created new landing pages for the site, worked on the home page ocassionally, created bookmarklets for internal use by coworkers, worked on a proof of concept for integrating Flickr photos and Google maps, and mentored other developers. I was part of two different Agile teams at different times while I was there: first, as part of the Cart/Checkout team, and later as part of the Folders & Lists MyLowes team.

RESTful Web Service Integration

I was involved in several projects that integrated complex, AJAX-heavy user interfaces with RESTful back-end services.

Technologies: JSP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery
Roles: Programming
